definition: fate is unfavorable (idiom); the omens are not good
surname Shi
old variant of 時|时[shi2]
o'clock/time/when/hour/season/period
to move/to transport/to use/to apply/fortune/luck/fate
(negative prefix)/not/no
to cross a river/to aid or relieve/to be of help
only used in 濟濟|济济[ji3 ji3]
used in place names associated with the Ji River 濟水|济水[Ji3 Shui3]/surname Ji

sentences.english: None of the great composers had a more unfortunate talent-to-luck ratio than Franz Schubert.
sentences.chinese: 从没有一个伟大的作曲家像舒伯特那样的时运不济。

sentences.english: The moles and birthmarks in these areas can indicate good fortune, or a lack of it.
sentences.chinese: 痣或胎记落到这些区域有可能象征好运或时运不济。

sentences.english: It worked against Forlan. It should work in favor of Suarez.
sentences.chinese: 弗兰时运不济，但现在的时机非常适合苏亚雷斯。

sentences.english: To all appearances he was just the commonplace planter who had fallen upon evil days .
sentences.chinese: 表面上看来，他完全是个时运不济的普通种植园主。

definition: born at the wrong time (idiom); unlucky (esp. to complain about one's fate)/born under an unlucky star/ahead of his time
circumstances/fate
the year's horoscope augurs ill (idiom); an unlucky year
to meet with many difficulties in one's life (idiom)
bad times, adverse fate (idiom)
to have talent but no opportunity (idiom)/to be an unrecognized talent
soured by the loss of one's hopes
luck (good or bad)
a hero with no chance of using his might/to have no opportunity to display one's talents
pinyin: ying1 xiong2 wu2 yong4 wu3 zhi1 di4

definition: not good/of no use
the time comes, fortune turns (idiom); to have a lucky break/things change for the better
to be plagued with misfortunes/precarious
to have good luck/lucky/in luck
heaven is jealous of heroic genius (idiom); the great have great hardship to contend with/those whom the Gods love die young
to have a lucky stroke/to try one's luck
to have a tough life/to meet much adversity in one's life
